org.usfirst.frc.team2077.video.projections

Class AbstractProjection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team2077.video.projections.AbstractProjection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RenderingProjection, SourceProjection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Birdseye, CubeMap3x2, Equidistant, Equirectangular, InverseTangentProjection, SineProjection, TangentProjection

    public abstract class AbstractProjection
extends java.lang.Object
implements SourceProjection, RenderingProjection
    Base implementation of both SourceProjection and RenderingProjection.

    © 2018

    Author:
    FRC Team 2077, R. A. Buchanan

                             double defaultFOV,
                             double defaultK)
        Source projection instance constructor.

        name - Configuration property key.
        videoSource - Input video source.
        defaultFOV - Horizontal field of view if not specified in configuration properties (degrees).
        defaultK - Projection K value if not specified in configuration properties.

      • AbstractProjection

        protected AbstractProjection(java.lang.String name,
                             VideoSource videoSource,
                             double defaultFOV,
                             double defaultK,
                             double setK)
        Source projection instance constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - Configuration property key.
        videoSource - Input video source.
        defaultFOV - Horizontal field of view if not specified in configuration properties (degrees).
        defaultK - Projection K value if not specified in configuration properties (ignored in this case, since setK overrides it).
        setK - Fixed projection K value.

      • transformPixelToCartesian

        public double[] transformPixelToCartesian(double renderingX,
                                          double renderingY)
        Description copied from interface: RenderingProjection
        Maps a point in rendering image coordinates to normalized rendering projection space.
        Specified by:
        transformPixelToCartesian in interface RenderingProjection
        Parameters:
        renderingX - Horizontal image coordinate in range 0 to width from left.
        renderingY - Vertical image coordinate in range 0 to width from top.
        Returns:
        {
        x (Horizontal projection space coordinate in range -1 to 1),
        y (Vertical projection space coordinate on same scale)
        }.

        Parameters:

        y - Vertical projection space coordinate on same scale.
        Returns:

      • getFocalLength

        public double getFocalLength()
        Returns:
        Focal length if explicitly set, or as computed from horizontal FOV.

      • renderingProjection

        public double[] renderingProjection(double projectionX,
                                    double projectionY)
        Description copied from interface: RenderingProjection
        Maps normalized source projection coordinates to source image coordinates. Maps a point in normalized projection coordinates to view-relative spherical vector.
        Specified by:
        renderingProjection in interface RenderingProjection
        Parameters:
        projectionX - Horizontal projection space coordinate in range -1 to 1.
        projectionY - Vertical projection space coordinate on same scale.
        Returns:
        {
        azimuth (Viewer-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward),
        polar (Viewer-relative spherical normal angle in radians outward from view axis)
        }.

      • sourceProjection

        public double[] sourceProjection(double world_o_clock,
                                 double world_from_center)
        Description copied from interface: SourceProjection
        Maps source-relative spherical view vector to normalized source projection coordinates.
        Specified by:
        sourceProjection in interface SourceProjection
        Parameters:
        world_o_clock - Viewer-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward.
        world_from_center - Viewer-relative spherical polar angle in radians outward from view axis.
        Returns:
        {
        x (Horizontal projection space coordinate in range -1 to 1),
        y (Vertical projection space coordinate on same scale).
        }.

      • transformRenderingToWorld

        public double[] transformRenderingToWorld(double azimuth,
                                          double polar)
        Description copied from interface: RenderingProjection
        Maps source-relative spherical view vector to world-relative spherical coordinates as supplied by source. World coordinate space is defined by the video source, and is relative to either the view axis of the source itself or to a global upward-looking axis.
        Specified by:
        transformRenderingToWorld in interface RenderingProjection
        Parameters:
        azimuth - Viewer-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward.
        polar - Viewer-relative spherical normal angle in radians outward from view axis.
        Returns:
        {
        azimuth (Viewer-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward),
        polar (Viewer-relative spherical normal angle in radians outward from view axis)
        }.
        See Also:
        SourceProjection.transformGlobalWorldToSource(double, double), SourceProjection.transformNominalWorldToSource(double, double)

      • transformGlobalWorldToSource

        public double[] transformGlobalWorldToSource(double azimuth,
                                             double polar)
        Description copied from interface: SourceProjection
        Maps global spherical view vector to source-relative spherical coordinates.
        Specified by:
        transformGlobalWorldToSource in interface SourceProjection
        Parameters:
        azimuth - World-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward.
        polar - World-relative spherical polar angle in radians outward from view axis.
        Returns:
        {
        azimuth (Image-relative spherical azimuth angle in radians clockwise from upward),
        polar (Image-relative spherical normal angle in radians outward from view axis)
        }.

      • isGlobal

        public boolean isGlobal()
        Description copied from interface: RenderingProjection
        Global source coordinate flag.
        Specified by:
        isGlobal in interface RenderingProjection
        Returns:
        True if the rendering projection expects the source to use global (vs source-relative) coordinates.

      • forwardProjection

        protected double forwardProjection(double angle)
        Computes the normalized distance from the center of the projection space to the projected location of an incident ray at a given polar angle from the view axis.
        Parameters:
        angle - Polar angle θ between view axis and incident ray.
        Returns:
        Polar radius between projection center and projected ray, as a fraction of focal length.

      • backProjection

        protected double backProjection(double radius)
        Computes the angle of an incident ray associated with a particular distance from the center of projection space.
        Parameters:
        radius - Polar radius between projection center and projected ray, as a fraction of focal length.
        Returns:
        Polar angle θ between view axis and incident ray.

      • mod

        protected static double mod(double angle,
                            double mod)
        Normalizes angles to range such as 0 - 2π.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle.
        mod - Divisor.
        Returns:
        Modulus in the range 0 - mod.

      • transform

        protected static double[] transform(double world_o_clock,
                                    double world_from_center,
                                    double[][] transform)

      • transformCartesianToPolar

        public static double[] transformCartesianToPolar(double x,
                                                 double y)
        Cartesian to polar coordinate conversion. Uses projection conventions.
        Parameters:
        x - -left, +right
        y - -up, +down
        Returns:
        {
        radius.
        azimuth angle (0 up, +cw).
        }

      • transformPolarToCartesian

        public static double[] transformPolarToCartesian(double radius,
                                                 double azimuth)
        Polar to cartesian coordinate conversion. Uses projection conventions.
        Parameters:
        radius - Radius.
        azimuth - Azimuth angle (0 up, +cw).
        Returns:
        {
        x, (-left, +right).
        y (-up, +down).
        }

      • transformCartesianToSpherical

        public static double[] transformCartesianToSpherical(double x,
                                                     double y,
                                                     double z)
        Cartesian to spherical coordinate conversion. Uses world conventions.
        Parameters:
        x - (-back, +front).
        y - (-left, +right).
        z - (-down, +up).
        Returns:
        {
        Radius.
        Azimuth angle (0 forward, +clockwise from above).
        Polar angle (0 upward, +downward).
        }

      • transformSphericalToCartesian

        public static double[] transformSphericalToCartesian(double radius,
                                                     double azimuth,
                                                     double polar)
        Spherical to cartesian coordinate conversion. Uses world conventions.
        Parameters:
        radius - Radius
        azimuth - Azimuth angle (0 forward, +clockwise from above).
        polar - Polar angle (0 upward, +downward).
        Returns:
        {
        x, (-back, +front).
        y, (-left, +right).
        z (-down, +up).
        }

        public static double[][] rotateXYZ(double degreesX,
                                   double degreesY,
                                   double degreesZ)
        Constructs a 3D rotation matrix.
        Parameters:
        degreesX - Degrees rotation about X axis.
        degreesY - Degrees rotation about Y axis.
        degreesZ - Degrees rotation about Z axis.
        Returns:
        rotateX(degreesX) X rotateY(degreesY) X rotateZ(degreesZ)
